intro: Scalesia affinis, commonly known as the giant lobelias, is a striking plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is known for its impressive height, often reaching up to 10 meters, making it one of the tallest shrubs in the world. Its leaves are broad and leathery, adapted to the humid, volcanic soil of its native habitat. Scalesia affinis plays an important ecological role in the Galápagos ecosystem, providing nectar for native pollinators.
